title: Support for Ukrainian Families
text: Airbnb is my go to because I like to feel like local when I travel. I also love being a Airbnb host. But I truly fell in love with Airbnb as a company when I saw how they are supporting families in Ukraine. Airbnb has waived 100% of their fees on bookings in Ukrainian cities so that all the money goes directly to the house and their families. You can provide direct support to hosts by booking a stay in Ukraine while the county is under siege from Russia. Don‚Äôt go, but book a stay. It‚Äôs an easy way to provide direct support to a family during this horrific war. Airbnb is also providing safe refuge for 100,000 Ukrainian‚Äôs they flee from the wreckage of their homes. This is why I love Airbnb.

title: The Sharing economy
text:
I love the people we meet from our Hosting with Airbnb. Our vacation rental is within our home. It‚Äôs a separate one bedroom daylight basement apartment. We feel it‚Äôs very important to meet our Guests as the original mission of Airbnb was to build relationships and share our homes as a way to do that: The Sharing Economy was the words Airbnb used. 
We have shared our home with so many wonderful people and made some lifelong friends!!
It‚Äôs sad that Airbnb has become just another reservation entity. So many of the listings do not have an owner living on site and the self-check In makes it easy for the Host to never even meet their Guests. 
Oh well, we‚Äôll keep meeting and greeting our Guests, building relationships and doing our part to be a part of the Sharing Economy! 
We love it!

title: WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER
text:
VERY DISAPPOINTED!! 
Airbnb only care about get their money. Don‚Äôt ever expect their help from anything. 
I LOST OVER $400 WORTH ITEMS AND AIRBNB NEVER HRLP!!
If anyone using the INSTANT booking option then please be careful. Airbnb not always verified the customer. They let a person without proper identification approved through instant book. And when I want to decline the customer they will decrease my Hosting Commitment Rate. 
The visitor stole every items that could be carried. And created big mess. My house is brand new, items in the house is new. 
When incidents happen, we contact AirBnB.
The customer service told us to use Request Money option from the visitor . After 3 days if then they will be involved. We did let them know that we have the next visitor check in within that day. So we have to rush out buy stuff and also clean up the room. 
After 3 days we request Airbnb involved. They have a girl call Emily email us. No matter how many time we ask she never tell her full name. We can‚Äôt call, they have us talk through email only. 
They make us have the police report. Old receipts only all the stolen items. 
We cleaned our room for the next visitor already so there is nothing we can show the police.
We took photos for prove but Airbnb still avoiding to take their responsibility. 
Total we lost over $400 and Airbnb not taking any responsibility.

title: Hidden fees, delayed withdrawals
text: I wanted to like this app, but the amount of hidden fees that get tacked on after they give you the total ‚Äúprice‚Äù is ridiculous. And there‚Äôs no way to know about them ahead of time, so after budgeting my honeymoon with the amount I thought I would be paying, I suddenly also owed $200 worth of ‚Äúservice fees‚Äù and ‚Äúresidency fees‚Äù which made the booking ridiculously more expensive. And when I try to make the payment, they wait to actually charge the money to my account so I have to keep the sum ready waiting for the random day upon which they‚Äôll decide to actually charge. Extremely inconvenient on every level. Nothing wrong with the hosts‚Äîthey‚Äôre all wonderful‚Äîbut definitely something wrong the corporation overall. I would explore other booking options and only use air bnb as a last resort.

title: Don‚Äôt like Airbnb anymore
text:
I used to use Airbnb for all my travel. I remember few years ago when they started the costumer service was great they responded right away now they dont, they used to give referal coupons. Now they grew so much a multimillion company and became stingy. everytime I have an issue now they tell are not willing to help. Wait time for replays is longer and they just make it sound like they want to help but they cant. they still tell you they want to satisfy your issue but at the end they cant. I found that other places like booking turn out to be cheaper and costumer service probably will be the same other than booking you dont have any body lying trying to say they will help you.
2 years ago I wouldve give airbnb 5 stars now I would give them ‚Äú0‚Äù I see that they are at 4.8 average but looks like it is from the past im sure that eventually they will get to 3 stars

title: They Don‚Äôt Protect Customers
text: I normally don‚Äôt write reviews but I am pretty disgusted by Air Bnb and how they treat their customers. I reserved a stay in AZ for new years but because of covid restrictions can‚Äôt travel out of state. They make cancellation policies very clear but no where on the listing does it have policies for date changes. The application lets me change the date until Nov 2021. The host declined it saying it doesn‚Äôt abide by their change policy but it isn‚Äôt anywhere on the listing. Someone from Air Bnb even acknowledged it wasn‚Äôt on the listing and said theyd contact the host and tell them to update their policy but did not help me change my dates. I called the host and Air Bnb asking for them to show me where the policy is that they are enforcing for the change of date denials and they can‚Äôt find it anywhere. Air Bnb still won‚Äôt help me. I am working with my credit card company to dispute this charge because neither the host nor Air Bnb are being helpful.

title: First time booking Airbnb was a mistake
text: This review isn‚Äôt about the app whatsoever, it was fine when I used it, BUT I never got to use it for a trip. I had never used Airbnb before, but me and some friends were going to New York for a long weekend and decided to get an Airbnb so we could have bedrooms for each person versus sharing one room at a hotel. Searched through tons of Airbnb‚Äôs to find one that was the right fit, booked it, and thought we were good to go. Flash forward to 5 days before we fly out and I get an automated message from Airbnb saying our reservation has been canceled!!!! No reasoning for the cancellation or any word from the host. Thank god we got a full refund, but I will never use Airbnb again. From other reviews it sounds like there is no consistency and no way to tell if the place you‚Äôre actually staying is what the listing looks like or if your host is going to screw you over. Don‚Äôt waste your time on Airbnb, just book a hotel.

title: Male function app
text: As a host/guest I love Airbnb, their customer service, their friendliness staff, everything is great! They are very helpful. But their app has so many problems. For example, you are in the middle of doin something, and the app suddenly close itself down and all your work goes to waste. Another thing, when a guest leaves a review, the app wont allow you to  respond a comment  on their review. The only way I can do this is to go on my desktop. Also if I am reading one of my guests reviews, I try to click on the host that reviewed their profiles or listing, guest what? That also doesn't work and I also have to do that on my desktop. It‚Äôs not convenient. They are wealthy company with lots of $. I think they can afford to hire great programers rather than cheap ones. There are so many other issues that takes for ever for me to explain here. I hope Airbnb look into their app. I don't understand why people say the app works well.

title: Please, PLEASE add a ‚Äúpet free‚Äù filter
text:
I love Airbnb. We travel often and much prefer airbnbs over hotels for our family. The app is mostly great. I‚Äôve appreciated a lot of the recent improvements, especially the ability to see total price for a stay. 

But PLEASE add a feature that will allow me to search only for homes that are ‚Äúpet free‚Äù. I am very sensitive to pet hair and it is very frustrating to search for a place to stay and then find the perfect place, only to have to eliminate it because after reading the listing I see pets are allowed. I understand people love their pets and want to travel with them, but we are not those people. Please make my life easier by adding a little ‚Äúno pets‚Äù check box to the list of amenities.

title: Air BnB discrimination
text: I booked multiple rooms through Airbnb for a trip to Vietnam. A day before my trip, I received an email from a host who informed me that my reservation had been canceled. Apparently, Airbnb decided that a criminal charge for possession of Marijuana over 15 years ago, when I was a teenager excludes me from using their service. I had used Airbnb for past trips and am unsure why they suddenly decided to discriminate against me for a mistake I made over a decade and a half ago in my teenage years. I understand that their company considers it a liability, but canceling all my reservations a day before my trip completely ruined my travel plans. I ended up having to sleep at the airport in a foreign country and had my bags stolen. I lost all my things, including an expensive laptop, camera, and tablet totaling over 4,000 dollars. Thanks, Airbnb your discriminatory  policy put me in danger and cost me thousands of dollars.

title: Bad customer Service
text: I only started using Airbnb after a coworker showed me the Experiences feature which I thought was pretty cool. So I tried to set up a trip with a few friends. I could book one experience, but as soon as I tried a second one, it started showing a prompt that my reservation is under review. I tried to contact support but they ghosted me. I had verified my identity using a Government ID so that can‚Äôt be the issue. The one I did book turned out to not be available at the time that was listed on the app. Now I do understand that this is not Airbnb‚Äôs fault but things like this leave a bad experience with the service overall. I don‚Äôt recommend anybody use this app other than to find out what is available and make the bookings through some other means. I don‚Äôt think I will be using Airbnb ever again.

title: No longer a worthwhile option
text: This used to be a great app, and a great way to get good deals while traveling. Unfortunately it‚Äôs gone way downhill in the last few years. The main problem is that the app makes it impossible to look at prices until you get to the checkout page, where you find that the great room you found has all sorts of hidden fee‚Äôs that often double, and occasionally quadruple the advertised cost (and that you explicitly filtered on). It‚Äôs honestly not worth the effort digging through all the misrepresentations. Add to that the fact that Airbnb prices in general have soared and it is now usually much more expensive than a regular hotel room. Unless you‚Äôre renting for at least a week and need a kitchen I wouldn‚Äôt bother with Airbnb at all.

title: App works, but AirBNB won‚Äôt come through for you
text:
On the first night of our stay: an apartment that was represented to have proper air conditioning‚Ä¶‚Ä¶just didn‚Äôt.  It was absolutely brutal and sweltering. Easily 90 degrees in the bedroom.  We contacted Airbnb to help us out with some alternate locations to stay for that night, just so we could get a solid sleep.  Nope. They just didn‚Äôt come through on the night of the issue. All they did was email the host, which I of course could have done.  Why have a 24 hour emergency help line when it is completely useless?  I dealt with 2 or 3 different people on the night of the issue, which took half of the night. Then they escalated my case. Beautiful. That‚Äôs the service I needed, right?  Of course it was, until the agent that my case was escalated to didn‚Äôt contact me until two days later. 

Folks, AirBNB will leave you hanging if you have an emergency. Trust me.

title: Process needs addressed‚Ä¶
text: My wife and I have had many good experiences with vacation rentals over the years but a recent poor experience with Airbnb prompts this 1-star review. Long story short as this will fall on def ears anyway - if you have any issues with a host or a refund, they need to be resolved within 14 days. This is a hard guideline. Once you're past 14 days you are unable to leave any sort of review for a host. In our case, the host hadn't come through on their word of a partial refund. After 14 days and losing all our leverage (unable to leave negative review) the host had no reason to come through on their word. There was nothing we could do and seemingly no repercussions for the host's behavior. We spent over $2,700 on a Hawaiian condo that had the neighbor's dirty toilet water dripping in our master bathroom and we were comped a $200 coupon for a future rental. This is not right and should be addressed.

title: HOSTS: SKIP THIS VERSION
text:
Airbnb has updated the performance section of the app to only show you info about your rating pretty much. You can no longer see any info about how much revenue you‚Äôre bringing in each month/year, cleaning fees, occupancy rate, etc. I‚Äôm so frustrated and I wish I hadn‚Äôt updated.

On another note, Airbnb is making it incredibly hard to comply with the law during this pandemic. Our state has made it illegal for Airbnb‚Äôs and hotels to operate for almost 2 months. Airbnb should have just automatically kept up with the state laws and shut down booking and searching for N.H. listings during that time, and automatically canceled people and given full refunds when that happened.

Instead, I‚Äôve had to spend so much time chasing after their customer service people getting them to cancel my guests who cannot legally stay here anymore and give them full refunds without penalizing either of us.

I realize they‚Äôre short staffed here, but if they just dedicated ONE person per state to keeping up with the state‚Äôs laws and then automatically canceled /made it impossible to search or host during those timeframes, it‚Äôd be way less work for everyone. I feel like I‚Äôm being punished for following the law and trying to keep my community, my cleaners, and my guests safe, as well as have fair treatment for my guests who need to be canceled.

title: Price range filter doesn‚Äôt include cleaning fee to show overall price
text: The app is generally great but when filtering out listings to fit your budget, you do not have an option to include the cleaning fee and extra chargers the hosts may have. This can be rather misleading. I was about to reserve a stay listed at $40 but on closer examination I realized that the listing also had a $275 cleaning fee, putting the rental far out of my price range. Not to mention that there is no way to filter out locations with minimum night stays that hike the price of your visit. The has app has come a long way but these issues have been a major problem. It takes longer than necessary to book a place because you simply cannot filter out deal breaker options, which isn‚Äôt great when you‚Äôre in fix for a place to stay

title: Denied booking for no reason
text: I have booked countless Airbnb‚Äôs, spent thousands of dollars on this app. I have perfect reviews from every single host that has reviewed me. I have had absolutely zero issues with Airbnb before. Tried to book a space for me and a couple friends on New Year‚Äôs Eve, I was denied based on ‚Äúpotential unauthorized parties‚Äù I reached out to the host, support, everything I could only to be left with no explanation. I have never had a party in an Airbnb, I have never even held a party in my own home. This one computer error has ruined our New Years plans. 2 of my other friends also tried to book the same spot and were given the same error. This is CLEARLY an error on AIRBNBs behalf. This needs to be fixed. This has left an extremely bad taste in my mouth concluding what has been 4+ years of perfect experiences with this app. All 3 parties involved loose here, including Airbnb.

title: Guest and Host
text:
Customer support on both ends (guest and host) is horrible! 

Call center is trained to apologise for inconvenience or holding the line but unable to resolve any issues. 

Frequently they lie out right sending automated message that they issue is resolved when it's not. 

They only advice is "try to uninstall the app" which in many cases is pontles. 

Last year I had problem with my listing being blocked and unlockable. I had back and forth with customer support. Including they closing the ticket with unresloved issues multiple times and me reopening it with another person who had to review the issue again. It took almost 2 weeks up untill the date with issue have passed. 

But guess what. This year it's the same issue on th same dates again. After 24h they closed the ticket without resolving it sending automated message "we are here for you if you need any further assistance". 

This is outright insulting and rude! More over I was able to reach the same support person inquiring again and they replied in broken English saying

 "I have gone ahead and checked and you can try now.

Please let me know if you need any further assistance or guidance for the same. I'll be more than welcome to assist you."

While the issue continue to persist and they did absolutely nothing.

title: No single female should use Airbnb
text: The management of Airbnb has clearly failed to protect women. I recently booked a trip where I arrived at the house which looked gorgeous on the app, only to find out that it was directly adjacent to an overpass with dozens of encampments and unhoused folks wandering around right next to the property. The garage door had clearly been recently broken into as it was covered with wood/cardboard. It was very dark and there were tents and broken down RVs surrounding the property. I felt very unsafe and feared my car would get broken into or the home. I had to book a hotel instead, which was an extra 1000. I contacted Airbnb and was told the situation did not qualify as a circumstance warranting a refund. To essentially require customers to put themselves in potentially dangerous situations ‚Äî or spend an unsuspecting 1000 dollars on other accommodations ‚Äî is both bad business and irresponsible. So disappointed.

title: I‚Äôd love it if there was a way to organize wishlists
text: The app got a massive makeover and I think it‚Äôs awesome so far. I just hope that in upcoming updates the developers could find a way that would allow users to search within their wishlists for destination instead of scrolling through every one. It would also be nice to have a drop down menu of previously made lists when adding new accommodations. That way I‚Äôm not manually typing out a new list name or accidentally duplicating a previously made list with the same destination name. I‚Äôd like to be able to consolidate previously made lists into larger categories similar to how we drag and drop apps into neat folders. Other than that, the app is great!

title: 10/10 Customer Service
text:
I was stuck in a situation, I had booked to stay in a home that didn‚Äôt meet it‚Äôs expectations. I refused to stay in the home, and I refused to allow my fianc√©e to even enter the place. We had no where to go, and I called customer service and got on the phone with an extremely professional case manager by the name of Anand. In the meantime I searched for a new place and found one quickly. They covered the difference in price on the next booking and assured me of a full refund on the previous. They made it a priority to help me expeditiously. It was the best, most polite and professional customer service experience I had every recieved. Thank you Anand, I hope you found this review. 

- Nicholas

title: airbnb doesn‚Äôt care about your safety during covid 19
text:
despite policies around hosts not being able to accept bookings or guests not being able to travel to covid lock down areas, airbnb is punishing guests to pay for non refundable policies which my host only changed AFTER he found out about covid 19 policies. my entire county as well as the county of the host is under lock down. we are NOT allowed to leave and travel on vacation as much as i‚Äôd like. hotels have cancelled our reservations proactively and given us a refund. airbnb says too bad, you lose hundreds of dollars because you want to keep your family, community safe during a time when ICU beds have dropped to 0.

have you considered not allowing hosts to have such strict cancellation policies during covid 19? they‚Äôre essentially keeping money they‚Äôre not supposed to be making in the first place. 

clearly airbnb is on the wrong side of history during a global pandemic. shame on you.

title: BEWARE HEALTH HAZARD NO REFUNDS ‚ÄºÔ∏è‚ÄºÔ∏è
text:
I had the longest time to get a refund from support people . My host had roaches and knowingly was living with them . When I found out because three roaches all different sizes was popping out ! I slept in my car at 3am in the middle of LA CALIFORNIA. & I‚Äôm from PA. The app and host don‚Äôt want to fully refund me and the host was very rude. I left the place with locking the door behind me and leaving the keys. I respected her and as of 3am it‚Äôs now 2:20p I still do not have a refund . They want to only refund me a night or something outrages . How am I still charged $46 for a cleaning fee & $6 for a service fee ! Infestation means your house isn‚Äôt clean and you didn‚Äôt give me a service because, I slept in my car. Not to mention I booked a great place in a week prior to South Carolina and had none of these issues . 
I thought because my host in South Carolina was amazing ! That the app held their community to higher standers. 

HOW FAIR DO THIS SOUND ??? ‚ÄºÔ∏è‚ÄºÔ∏è‚ÄºÔ∏è‚ÄºÔ∏è
book at your own risk...

title: NOT WORTH THE MONEY BOOK A HOTEL
text: I know this will get buried by the admins but idc. Airbnb is literally the equivalent of a snake oil salesman selling ‚Äúmiracle elixirs‚Äù to fools and widows. I kid you not I have booked with them twice and they have been the two single worst experiences in my life and I‚Äôve been to New Jersey. Absolutely useless hosts, Airbnb support takes hours and sometimes even days and don‚Äôt ever resolve the issues. Disgusting living situations and no refunds whatsoever. You think you‚Äôre gonna save money on your vacation and end up enjoying it more but the Airbnb becomes the most negative part of your trip. Spend the extra money and get a hotel. Please If not for your sake, mine. Airbnb customer support is OJ Simpson and the customer is Ron Goldman. Spend a little more money and get a hotel, I promise you that you‚Äôll regret it if you don‚Äôt. It may not be every time that it‚Äôs awful but eventually you‚Äôll stay in one that will make you never stay again. Good riddance.

title: App is key for great experience
text: I have a lot of people asking me how we do Airbnb. For some it‚Äôs a fairly new idea, and that means people don‚Äôt always feel safe trying it out because it involves differentiating between good and bad options in finding spaces that should feel very clean and safe. The app does exactly what it should do to help people learn the ropes and find great places. Great sorting options, great communication tools, great support and means of problem-solving, great selection of places to stay. I believe the host criteria is pretty rigorous to. If people aren‚Äôt maintaining good places and giving good experiences, they either are rejected or they fall to the bottom. That‚Äôs a must. Great app.

title: Payout issues unresolved
text:
I‚Äôm a super host with over 80 properties. Generally Airbnb works great, but I‚Äôm having such a difficult time now that I‚Äôm spending the time to write a review that will overshadow all of the good things I‚Äôve experienced so far. I was do a payout of over $1000 several weeks ago. When I didn‚Äôt receive it, I called tech-support which is generally very good. I don‚Äôt know what happened this time but I have been escalated to a higher up for the third time now and I‚Äôm still not getting any resolution.

Sure, the app functions great and exposure through the app is awesome, but none of that really matters to me when my bank account is overdrawn because I didn‚Äôt get my money. What makes this even worse is that the guest had some unrelated issues for which I refunded her $500. Airbnb took that money out of my account so technically I‚Äôm in the hall on this day because I haven‚Äôt received anything but have paid out a refund. Unacceptable!

title: Not a real company
text:
Well sure, they have a site and will take money, but for what? Aligning a host and a guest? If that‚Äôs all they did, I would like them. However, when they step back into a reservation that was accepted by both host and guest months in advance, Day of arrival, in Hawaii... it becomes clear that it‚Äôs all internet smoke and mirrors. 
Don‚Äôt take my word for it, see for yourself. Open your account and pretend that you just got off the plane in Hawaii to a text message from your house host asking why you canceled, when you didn‚Äôt. What do you do? Find a phone number to call. There isn‚Äôt one. No place to call for support.   Guest has no place to go and host is out the money. No rational given, no place to call. Why no customer support number listed? Because they don‚Äôt take any responsibility for their ‚Äúproduct‚Äù. No product = not a real company. Try and call them with a hypothetical problem BEFORE you trust them with your vacation.

title: Summer Airbnb
text: I rented out an airbnb for the summer. There have been multiple problems we have encountered through out the summer. Some of those problems include our door knob not working, our fridge not working - rotting all our food, a leak in our closet (water leak from roof dripping into closet rotting some of our cloths/shoes), a leak in our shower (we have to have a towel to prevent leakage outside), and as I am currently writing this review I am laying in my bed with no electricity....... what bothers me is that we are paying a good amount of money for our apartment this summer, but it dosent seem like we have gotten the proper utilities promised. I understand things can go wrong while renting an Airbnb... but dealing with it this summer has been a headache. I was so excited to stay in an Airbnb this summer, and was looking forward to a great experience but I would sadly not recommend Airbnb to anyone as of right now. I would definitely look into ALL the details prior to choosing an apartment.

title: Hotels Making A Comeback!
text:
I loved and used AirBnb for years and after this last experience I will NEVER! 

Booked a weekend trip back in July for October 2023. Did the payment plan so paid a $288 deposit. Kept checking my app and the trip looked good to go - no messages, alerts, or info on due payment. Then a week before my trip see it‚Äôs cancelled by guest. 

After panicking I find out AirBnb cancelled my trip for failed payment. I paid with apple pay initially and have the same credit card with apple pay set up on my phone. Apparently they sent an email (not my main email account so did not see) but gave ZERO alert or information on the due or failed payments on the app. I had assumed it would notify me on the app as that is how I always manage everything for my trips and they even tell you to only talk to hosts on the app for security purposes. 

Terrible policy and customer service. My friends sadly have similar stories of trips ruined from this company and fighting for a deserved refund.  

Luckily we booked a hotel but now I have to fight to get my deposit back. Stressful experience - I will never use Airbnb again and do not recommend it anymore. 

*I will happily update my review if Airbnb makes it right with a refund and hopefully look at their policies/notifications.

title: Banned me for reporting abuse by my travel companion
text: I reported domestic violence in the hopes of getting help for a different place to stay and not only did they ban my partner (understandable) they banned me from the platform! I‚Äôm being punished for reporting being attacked. How does this make sense? They cancelled my reservation without my or the hosts consent. I was forced to leave and was stranded. The person I talked to later suggested that I get a ride to a hotel from the abusive guy I reported. They were willing to first arrange three nights in a hotel and then it went down to one. How am i supposed to afford 3.5 weeks in a hotel all of a sudden? I was stuck in the middle of the jungle in Mexico with no Ubers or cabs around and all my luggage for a month long trip. The customer service was 100% aware of this. They were condescending, rude, uncaring and definitely victim blaming. I genuinely hope I‚Äôm able to sue them for this.

title: Airbnb‚Äôs customer service is amazing.
text: Airbnb is really the best at what it does. I‚Äôm so happy I found this service. Two hosts are separate occasions couldn‚Äôt accommodate for my stay in Orlando, Florida. At first I was disappointed because refund process takes 5 to 6 business days. And I was also very worried because my family and I didn‚Äôt have a place to stay. I called Airbnb customer service and was surprised I was even able to speak to a live agent. Airbnb‚Äôs representatives really went above and beyond to find me a host to accommodate my stay in Orlando twice. I never have to worry about this service. Airbnb‚Äôs representatives and hosts are extremely trustworthy and very good people.

title: Fantastic Customer Service
text: I never write these but I felt compelled because of how AirBnB went above and beyond to remedy a situation.  I use them for work at least 3 times a week. Recently I showed up to an already booked and confirmed apartment for the week and when I got arrived, the owner answered the door and said he couldn‚Äôt let me stay because he ‚Äúwas sick‚Äù.  So I was then stuck with no place to stay for the next three days.  I called AirBnB support and Maria was so nice and calm.  They put me up in a great little boutique hotel right by my work in downtown St Pete.   It was a great three days and I am very impressed by how they took care of everything.  I continue using g AirBnB weekly and will do so for the foreseeable future.

title: Reservations at Rockwell Texas
text: I paid for a reservation for a single bedroom and upon arrival, when I called my host, I got to realize that the place was already booked. I called my customer service at 4ish pm and they said that they will fix my problem and find me an alternative place. I‚Äôm new to Texas area and customer service at AirBnB is terrible. I made a separate reservation and this time, the reservation straight to pending. The customer service department has no clue what Is going on and have no idea what the hosts are doing. I got my money refunded but I drove an hour away and every time I call the helpline, the hang up on me or they tell me to wait. I‚Äôm forced to spend my night outside and I don‚Äôt recommend it to anyone. Airbnb has lost its standard. I will take legal action for wasting my time and transferring my reservation and cancelling it without my consent. My plans were effected and my time has been wasted. Completely disappointed.

title: They don‚Äôt care about customers
text: This app is garbage, the commercialization of airbnb has led to hosts and guests both behaving in corrupt ways. I had a booking where the host asked me to cancel because she realized it was worth more than she listed. When I refused she convinced customer service to cancel on my behalf so that she wouldn‚Äôt suffer from any penalties while getting my booking dates blacked out. In the end airbnb doesn‚Äôt care because they will get more money out of whoever books my dates despite the host‚Äôs actions clearly violating the terms of service. The sooner airbnb dies and goes away the better. I‚Äôll be taking my business to hotels from now on. I have had a few good experiences on this platform but after finally reading so many bad experiences and having one myself I‚Äôve decided to boycott airbnb. Shame on this company and their worthless outsourced customer support that does nothing.

title: Little usability goes a long way
text:
Why can I not save my preferences when searching for places to stay, I‚Äôm constantly having to re-enter my search criteria, which NEVER changes. For some reason an app that‚Äôs 10+ years old has a user interface that‚Äôs so carelessly designed that I‚Äôm constantly checking the same check boxes over and over and over and over. How hard is it to let me set default search preferences, and tweak them as needed? 

Also, the growing number of scams cropping up on the platform have become rather disconcerting, beware of new hosts with with few reviews. I don‚Äôt feel that Airbnb does as much as it could to keep scammers off the platform and their heavy use of NDAs keeps you from hearing about the guests that have really bad experiences.

title: Great, but review carefully
text: I‚Äôve stay in many, many Airbnb‚Äôs over the last few years and I am often impressed. One time my host had to leave and said I had to leave too, family emergency I guess, but Airbnb support immediately had me book a local hotel up to 250/night and reimbursed it as soon as I sent the receipt. That being said, there is a lot of misleading advertising on there, I‚Äôm currently sitting in a 3 bed, 2 bath house that was advertised as 11 guests, 7 bed house. It is not. It has 5 TWIN BUNK BEDS, 1 queen, and a pull out couch. I do not see any adults sleeping in a twin bunk bed on vacation, much less 2 in one bed. It is also not a full house, as advertised, it is a small duplex, nothing wrong with that, just not as advertised. I paid way too much for what I got.

title: Zero customer service
text:
Host failed to respond to my request and I had to cancel it as I had to book the room immediately (was in the last minute kind if situation). The money taken by airbnb, of course, is frozen in my credit card account and not accessible for the 4th day already. Upon checking twice with my bank, they confirmed that there is nothing they can do regarding the transaction that has been approved from the merchant. The merchant - airbnb - on the other hand says that there is nothing they can do as the bank is the one handling the transaction. Zero willingness to help, zero action taken, zero understanding and ‚Äúhuman factor‚Äù involved in the process of refunding the money for the service that never happened.

Being taken for an idiot and footballed from one company to another - one of the worst experiences I have ever had. Will do my best to not use this app again.

title: Limiting options
text: Super limited to search for an entire home since AirBnb changed its design with different accommodations types (room, beach, lake, country, etc). How about just adding HOUSE option on that list? I don‚Äôt want a room, neither do I want a castle. Besides this ordeal, the new features combines rentals when there isn‚Äôt one option available for entire chosen stay. How about keeping these features optional so we can have control at what to look for?!? This update makes it impossible to search for house in specific cities. The map adjusts throughout the globe instead of staying in the specific chosen area making the search utterly complicated and lengthy. Please fix it back! I just want to search for an entire home wherever I want to search with my specific dates without this whole mess. Thanks.

title: Bad at basic needs for a host
text:
This app has never been great for hosts, but then again Airbnb has a reputation of how it treats hosts. I‚Äôm likely dropping it completely soon.

The most basic thing a host needs is instant access to messages and updates (red bubbles on the app icon) when a message is new or unread. I don‚Äôt get hardly any. In fact, if I didn‚Äôt get the texts to my personal phone I‚Äôd miss 90% of all guest messages; even new bookings. I just got a text for a new booking, logged into the app and had to refresh multiple times to even find the notification message. 

It‚Äôs bad enough that I only keep roughly 2/3 of what my guests have to pay and I‚ÄôM the one who bears that blame for being too expensive. Air bnb voluntarily began collecting hotel tax here for my city and state (around 12%) long before it was required by law

title: Constant Emails
text: Cool app. But do we really need 34 emails per week about air BNB? Also when you book a place and the app suddenly stops working and takes you to the front page again to start over, you will get double booked even though you only booked one time, then you will lose your reservation while on the phone with Air BNB attempting to help them fix the app issues, Then you will have to wait over a week to get your $500 back. Cool app, big hassle though, then clearing out 34 emails from Air BNB that had nothing to do with the app problems, just advertising and marketing other local business with constant email spam and constant daily requests for reviews of places we stay and stuff like that is a bit excessive ...... 3 stars at best.

title: Horrible customer service, expensive and unreliable
text: I do not get the raves for Airbnb. I have made three bookings on Airbnb, thinking I would give the service one more chance each time. All three experiences have been a disaster. Customer service is horrendous. Requests for refunds are still not handled after more than a week. I only get emails in the middle of the night saying that they are unable to reach the host despite me having been able to reach the host daily for the past week. This leads me to suspect that they have outsourced their customer service to some country in the opposite side of the world. After accounting for cleaning and booking fees, you are lucky if you get a small discount on your lodging compared to professionally managed hotels, but you get none of usual amenities. Do yourself a favor and go for professionally managed properties. It will save you lots of headaches and money.

title: DO NOT BOOK WITH AIRBNB!!!! They have a horrible refund policy
text: I booked a Airbnb on accident and tried canceling it . The total was 490$ and only received a 160$ credit . Airbnb is a scam I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it to anyone . Your better off booking a hotel at the rates they provide . There direct customer service line doesn‚Äôt resolve refunds also making it a waste of time . They extend on keeping your money by saying a case manager will call you to shut you up . There just as bad as the airlines on refunds . They don‚Äôt wanna loose any money so they simply put on hold so you‚Äôll get frustrated and forget about your hard earned money. DO NOT BOOK most Airbnb‚Äôs have secret cameras in the homes leaving you with no privacy . Plus they count the people who enter the residences and charge you accordingly , hotels don‚Äôt do this . Airbnb is possibly the biggest scam Next to the Ponzi scheme . Ceos are banking money on all the fees they charge working class people it‚Äôs a shame !!!

title: Love hosting my extra room on Airbnb!
text:
Hosting out my whole house did not work out for me (stressed me out too much). However, the extra bedroom is turning out great. I love hosting young folks and pets. In my experience, older folks are grouchy and critical. Not all of course, but most. Young people are forgiving and happy. I don‚Äôt understand it, look at the world we left them (oops, my own grouch)! I love learning from them to watch out for my own old lady grouchiness! I‚Äôm alone with pets (no family) so psychologically (& definitely financially), Airbnb has saved me.

I also like Airbnb‚Äôs customer service people. I don‚Äôt much care for their website, but slowly and surely I‚Äôm figuring out the clunky thing (thanks customer service)!

title: If in Asheville, stay at Cardinals Inn!
text: Well, I just surprised myself, I rarely give all the maximum points in reviews as there's always something that could be improved, well, not in this case! Centrally located yet quiet, gorgeous home with tons of thoughtful details. Being an architect my eyes were wandering through all the little details of the home and its surroundings, a feast for the eye! Check in/out was clear and a breeze and if I would have shown up with nothing on me everything I could have needed was provided. Well thought out with love to detail! Really hoping this is still around for my next stay in Asheville, thank you Fay & Marc for having me! PS I hear something about chocolate connoisseurs, I'm intrigued!

title: Nice app but isn't up to date and AirBnB has issues
text:
Adding to the review: the browser version shows all fees when viewing a property but the app does not show them until you go to reserve. With such a huge range of cleaning fees and hidden fees it can make a big difference. 

Original and review:
App is nice and easy to use but in looking for a vacation spot in the Smokies I contacted multiple owners about homes that showed being available and was told it was booked. Ended up going to Priceline and booking at one of the same resorts I tried through AirBnB at $30 cheaper. Maybe it was the owners booking through other places and not updating AirBnB or maybe the app is not real time. I don't know but it made for a bad experience and I likely won't use it again.

title: Never using Air BNB again
text:
I‚Äôve been an air bnb user for years. I always heard of bad experiences, and watched the ridiculous fees raise during this time. 
It wasn‚Äôt until I had rented an air bnb in San Carlos that I had the worst experience, and Air BNB did nothing to help.
The house we rented was old, and had various things broken i.e. the towel rack. It also listed it had six beds when in fact it only had three. Nevertheless, we were like whatever. 
Until the window frame and the window fell out of the door. The neighbor who claimed to be the daughter of the host, lied to the police and said we were fighting and slamming doors all day. When in fact, we were out of the house most of the day and were being quiet for a party town. The Mexican police came, threatened to take a young girl to jail. The host then calls us, screams at us and tells us to leave. We were forced to unsafely sleep on the streets because all of the hotels were booked. 
Anyways, we tried to contact air bnb this whole time and no one got back to us. The company Air BNB actually TOOK DOWN our honest review, warning others that this house is a scam. Air BnB controls the reviews of places, in order to continue making money. I‚Äôll be taking my money to VRBO and hotels from now on.
I do not recommend using Air Bnb.

title: Horrible experience
text:
I was part of a party of 7 that all booked an air b n b for a getaway weekend in Atlanta. 

As we arrive, noticed the house yard and the patio and spa was not guest ready.  Was dirty and full of spiderwebs. To top it off downstairs was full of mold and unsafe for us to stay.

I hope their listing is not avail for the public to reserve for safety 

Upon cancellation, air b n b would not let us book another reservation for that day.  Even with each of us trying w our own accounts. Spend 5-6 hours going through support with no solution.  Very unconventient 

After contacting a new host and agreeing to the reservation air b n b still denied the transaction.

The phone support is even worse, you have agents fwd calls to another agent that cannot 

I have never delt with such poor customer service for a simple task for booking and which we were still not able to book a reservation.

My suggestion is to make sure y‚Äôall have someone inspect these rental properties prior for a guest arrival for future reference 

None the less, this will be my last experience trying to book with this company very disappointed on this weekend experience. I would never recommend this company and refer friends and family to seek elsewhere that offers this service.

The charge will be disputed!

title: Great app with one bad experience
text: Used Airbnb in both the US and Philippines. I had an overall great experience until recently during a trip to Lake Tahoe. We checked into a property that was very dirty (even found a dead mouse) and after I was unable to settle the issue with the owner I brought it up with the staff at Airbnb. I was able to get in contact with a manager ‚ÄúAna‚Äù initially but after sending the requested proof I had no other response. It has been almost a month now and I have had no resolution. As the group coordinator for the Tahoe trip, I was very embarrassed by condition of the property and had hoped to refund group some money. We literally spent an hr cleaning areas of the property. Other than that incident I haven‚Äôt had a problem with Airbnb but I‚Äôm thinking of switching to another travel app and giving them a chance

title: Dont use during the uncertain times
text:
Unfortunately not the best place to book during  these uncertain times when travel restrictions are more or less being changed every week. Book at a hotel and they will provide you with credit for a future stay. Book an Airbnb and they will ‚Äútry to convince‚Äù the host to refund you your money. However, what incentive does the host have? None.

My family was forced to quarantine during a stay at Hawaii. Little did we know that quarantining at an Airbnb is illegal. If we had known, we likely would not have booked an Airbnb. Unfortunately, we were not able to get a refund on the Airbnb despite having cancelled less than 36 hours since making the reservation.

Airbnb‚Äôs resolution center unfortunately has no say as the cancellation policy overrides everything, even when the government deems it illegal. Our first vacation in over a year and the family is -$2,300.

title: Changing the price of the apartment after confirmed booking
text: This was my first time using this program and I was really happy with the search engine and organization of everything, however I booked an apartment for my trip to Ukraine and got message next day from a host that he is requesting more money after the booking was already confirmed. I cancelled the booking right away and not waiting 5-7 business days for the money to return to me. I contacted the company Airbnb and they said that hosts absolutely cannot change the price after booking had been confirmed. I reported the host. I asked my friend in Ukraine to book an apartment, thinking she might have a better luck because she is there at the moment. The same thing had happened to her as well. This really wore my trust thin to the company. I am waiting for the issue hopefully to be resolved and to prevent those people breaking the rules and still staying part of Airbnb.
